intro.content:
This is a super description for the weekly newsletter.

hero.description: One Facebook Group, Gitxsan Got Talent, is renewing interest in the language.
hero.title: To revitalise their ‘severely endangered’ language, Gitxsan get creative.

randomArticles.description: Jim Glaub and Dylan Parker decided to write back to children’s letters after receiving hundreds of them.
randomArticles.title: Couple who get hundreds of Santa letters have replied for 10 years.

randomArticles.description: Tokelau, Niue, and the Cook Islands, Tonga, Samoa, and Tuvalu are on the list.
randomArticles.title: New Zealand to purchase Covid vaccines for Pacific Island neighbours.

randomArticles.description: A short film about collecting, cycling caps, art and design.
randomArticles.title: One Thing Leads to Another – or what I've learned from collecting cycling caps.

randomArticles.description: Policy change due in 2021 will allow gay and bisexual men in long-term relationships to give blood.
randomArticles.title: Blood donor rules to be relaxed for gay and bisexual men in England

randomArticles.description: The last two decades has seen unprecedented success in controlling malaria, according to the WHO’s Report.
randomArticles.title: WHO report highlighted progress on tackling malaria

animalCorner.description: And he seems to like it!
animalCorner.title: "I put on some happy hardcore for the bird"
This is the best action film of the year

animalCorner.description: If you photograph a squirrel juuuuust right, you can make it look like a superheroe. Here is why.
animalCorner.title: About squirrels posing like superheroes
